Sure, here are some examples of countries that have successfully attracted investment from Overseas Chinese through policies:

1. Singapore: Singapore is one of the most successful countries in attracting investment from Overseas Chinese. It has a business-friendly environment, low tax rates, and investment protection policies in place. It is also a hub for financial services and technology, which attracts investors from all over the world.

2. Malaysia: Malaysia has implemented several policies to attract Overseas Chinese investors, including tax incentives, streamlined business registration procedures, and relaxed visa requirements. Malaysia has also invested in infrastructure development to improve transportation and connectivity with China.

3. Australia: Australia has a large population of Overseas Chinese, and the government has implemented policies to encourage Chinese investment. These include relaxed visa requirements, tax incentives, and investment protection laws. The Australian government has also developed mentoring programs and networking opportunities to help Overseas Chinese investors navigate the business environment in Australia.

4. Canada: Canada has a policy of multiculturalism, which has made it attractive to people from all over the world, including Overseas Chinese investors. The Canadian government has implemented policies to streamline business registration and offer investment protection. Canada has also provided support for startups and entrepreneurs through its Startup Visa program.

5. The United States: The U.S. government has implemented policies to attract Overseas Chinese investors, including EB-5 visa program, which grants residency to foreign investors who create jobs in the U.S. The U.S. has also relaxed visa requirements for Chinese investors and established programs to help them navigate the business environment.
